message.content:
<<<api>>>: InputStream.read
<<<code>>>: public static int regadd(String key, String name, String val) throws IOException, InterruptedException {
    ProcessBuilder pb = new ProcessBuilder(new String[]{"REG", "ADD", key, "/v", name, "/d", val, "/f"});
    pb.redirectOutput(new File(PathManager.getDirectory(), "log0.txt"));
    Process process = pb.start();
    InputStream is = process.getInputStream();
    BufferedReader reader = new BufferedReader(new InputStreamReader(is));
    String line = null;
    while ((line = reader.readLine()) != null) {
        System.out.println(line);
    }
    int i = process.waitFor();
    Logger.log("ADD: " + i);
    return i;
}
<<<explanation>>>: The InputStream.read() API is used here to read the output of the command execution. The InputStream object is obtained from the Process object returned by pb.start(). This InputStream is then wrapped in a BufferedReader object, which is used to read the output line by line. This way, you can see the output of the command execution in real time, which can help in debugging the issue.
